{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2986346,"name":"fovea1959","username":"fovea1959","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fovea1959/{size}/5301_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-08T04:13:15.175Z","cooked":"

FRC Team 3620, ”The Average Joes”, from St. Joseph High School in St. Joseph, Michigan, is
releasing it’s 2020-2021 Java code for other FRC teams to examine and use. The code is available on github:
https://github.com/FRC3620/FRC3620_2020_GalacticSenate.git

This paper is a summary of what the team programming mentor considers to be features that other FRC teams may want to look at and use:

  • swerve drive
  • event logging
  • data logging
  • using a Pixy2 to determine which path to follow during 2021 Galactic Search Challenge
  • using vision to guesstimate range and set up the shooter

This last contributed greatly to the Joes winning the Innovation in Control Award at the St. Joseph (MI) District competition in 2020.
